CN.content:

Paragraph: A maximal PCE of 4.89% with an V OC of 0.84 V , a J SC of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 56.0% was achieved for the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM - based devices.

Let's think step by step.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid material names:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: A maximal PCE of 4.89% with an V OC of 0.84 V , a J SC of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 56.0% was achieved for the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM - based devices.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to material properties:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |

These three properties are all related to the performance of the solar cell material described in the paragraph. PCE stands for "power conversion efficiency," V OC stands for "open-circuit voltage," and J SC stands for "short-circuit current."
